s.text: Ingest these toxic bacteria, and you experience watery diarrhea and severe abdominal pain at first, bloody stools next.
This rapid blanket approval of irradiation by the establishment naturally stirred my suspicions.
The bug lives in the guts of about 1 percent of cattle and contaminates meat when digestive contents spill where they shouldn't during slaughter.
Compare that with, say, car accidents, which kill 40,000 people a year, or smoking, which kills over 400,000.
Advocates like to point out that the waste hasn't killed anyone, but kids die every year from food poisoning.
Thanks to officials who pushed for a recall, Hudson hamburgers didn't kill anyone.
Compare that with, say, car accidents, which kill 40,000 people a year, or smoking, which kills over 400,000.
Since fungi are killed, radiation-pasteurized food lasts longer, too--up to two weeks in the fridge instead of a few days.
Irradiators containing cobalt-60 or another radioactive source would bombard hamburger, apple juice, and other foods with gamma rays, killing resident bacteria and parasites.
(You may recall that toxic E. coli showed up in alfalfa sprouts two months ago, and in Odwalla apple juice last year.)
Irradiators containing cobalt-60 or another radioactive source would bombard hamburger, apple juice, and other foods with gamma rays, killing resident bacteria and parasites.
(You may recall that toxic E. coli showed up in alfalfa sprouts two months ago, and in Odwalla apple juice last year.)
Irradiators containing cobalt-60 or another radioactive source would bombard hamburger, apple juice, and other foods with gamma rays, killing resident bacteria and parasites.
Meat is the most common source of E. coli O157:H7, but raw milk, vegetables, and fruit juice have carried it in recent outbreaks.
(You may recall that toxic E. coli showed up in alfalfa sprouts two months ago, and in Odwalla apple juice last year.)
